paragraphs.text:
%md
> If you see 'Interpreter binding' above, just hit `Save` without deselecting any interpreters.

## Welcome to Flight Delay prediction example.

##### This example shows the fokkowing:

* 1.Import dependencies - including space data class
* 2.Read csv file containing actual flight details with delays into the space calss. 
* 3.Possible to Enrich the delay records with weather data of the same date at flight origin and destination and if its holiday etc. 
* 4.Save data to the grid
* 5.Train machine learning  algo with grid data so it will be able to predict if there will be delay(todo test + improve the model ) 
* 6.Save the model to the grid 
* 7.Load the model from the grid and predict flight delays for new data coming from kaka this will usually be done in diffrent job(possible to add  weather forecast for related date and loacationd)
* 8.Inform the grid on predicted delays
* 9.Grid will use delay objects to trigger logic (event container in space)

##### This is a live tutorial, you can run the code yourself. _(click `Run` button in each paragraph from top to bottom)_

msg.data:
If you see ‘Interpreter binding’ above, just hit Save without deselecting any interpreters.

Welcome to Flight Delay prediction example.

This example shows the fokkowing:
  • 1.Import dependencies - including space data class
  • 2.Read csv file containing actual flight details with delays into the space calss.
  • 3.Possible to Enrich the delay records with weather data of the same date at flight origin and destination and if its holiday etc.
  • 4.Save data to the grid
  • 5.Train machine learning algo with grid data so it will be able to predict if there will be delay(todo test + improve the model )
  • 6.Save the model to the grid
  • 7.Load the model from the grid and predict flight delays for new data coming from kaka this will usually be done in diffrent job(possible to add weather forecast for related date and loacationd)
  • 8.Inform the grid on predicted delays
  • 9.Grid will use delay objects to trigger logic (event container in space)
This is a live tutorial, you can run the code yourself. (click Run button in each paragraph from top to bottom)

paragraphs.title: Import dependencies

// Space classes dependecies
z.load("../../../../insightedge-training/Day5/17 Flight Delay Demo/Lab-17.1 - Flight Delay Demo/target/FlightDelayDemo-1.0.0-SNAPSHOT.jar")

paragraphs.title: Loading from the grid as DataFrame and register as view - in order to use sql in later paragraphs

val df = spark.read.grid[DelayRec]
df.printSchema()


df.createOrReplaceTempView("DelayRecView") // for sark sql needed only for data that is not in space.

val notDelayed = df.filter(df("depDelay") < 15).count() //example for filter

paragraphs.title: Query Grid Data - Delays per day of the week
paragraphs.text:
%insightedge_jdbc


select dayOfWeek, case when depDelay > 15 then 'delayed' else 'ok' end , count(1)
from DelayRec
group by dayOfWeek , case when depDelay > 15 then 'delayed' else 'ok' end

paragraphs.title: Loading RDD with SQL
paragraphs.text:
%spark
val sqlRdd = sc.gridSql[DelayRec]("depDelay > ?", Seq(15))
val count = sqlRdd.count()

msg.data:

paragraphs.title: Create a Machine learning model based on grid data and save the model to the grid
paragraphs.text:
%spark

import org.apache.spark.mllib.regression.LabeledPoint
import org.apache.spark.mllib.linalg.Vectors
import org.apache.spark.mllib.feature.StandardScaler
import org.apache.spark.mllib.classification.LogisticRegressionWithSGD

 def gen_features(rec: DelayRec): (String, Array[Double]) = {
      val values = Array(
        rec.getDepDelay().toDouble,
        rec.getMonth().toDouble,
        rec.getDayOfMonth().toDouble,
        rec.getDayOfWeek().toDouble,
        rec.getHour().toDouble,
        rec.getDistance().toDouble
      )
      new Tuple2(rec.getId(), values)
    }
    
 def parseData(vals: Array[Double]): LabeledPoint = {
        LabeledPoint(if (vals(0)>=15) 1.0 else 0.0, Vectors.dense(vals.drop(1)))
    }

// Load rdd from the grid
val delayRecRdd = sc.gridRdd[DelayRec]()

// Prepare training set
val data_2007 = delayRecRdd.map(delayRec => gen_features(delayRec)._2)
val parsedTrainData = data_2007.map(parseData)
parsedTrainData.cache
val scaler = new StandardScaler(withMean = true, withStd = true).fit(parsedTrainData.map(x => x.features))
val scaledTrainData = parsedTrainData.map(x => LabeledPoint(x.label, scaler.transform(Vectors.dense(x.features.toArray))))
scaledTrainData.cache



scaledTrainData.take(3).map(x => (x.label, x.features)).foreach(println)


// Build the Logistic Regression model (numIteration should be much higher for accurecy)
val model_lr = LogisticRegressionWithSGD.train(scaledTrainData, numIterations=20)


///ToDo test the model agianst test data, improve using other algo if required and afterward save it to the grid

//Save the model to the grid
model_lr.saveToGrid(sc, "DelayModel")

paragraphs.text:
%md
At this stage we want to simulate a new data and predict if new flight is going to be delayed according to the model,We can either
put new data in kafka and read here the data from the stream related to newFlights topic, or read a csv with the new data.

msg.data:
At this stage we want to simulate a new data and predict if new flight is going to be delayed according to the model,We can either
put new data in kafka and read here the data from the stream related to newFlights topic, or read a csv with the new data.

paragraphs.title: Simulate new data reading CSV and save it to the grid
paragraphs.text:
%spark
import com.gigaspaces.DelayRec
import org.insightedge.spark.implicits.all._


val data = sc.textFile("../../../../Data/2008.csv").map(line => line.split(",")).filter(rec => rec(4).toString() != "NA").filter(rec => rec(0) !="Year").filter(rec => rec(21).toString() != "1").filter(rec => rec(16).toString() == "ORD").filter(rec => rec(1).toString() == "1").filter(rec => rec(2).toString() == "3").map(rec => new DelayRec( rec(9).toString(),rec(0).toInt,rec(1).toInt,rec(2).toInt,rec(3).toInt,rec(5).toInt,rec(15).toInt,rec(16).toString(),rec(18).toDouble))
   
//see how the data looks like    
data.take(5).map(x => x.toString()).foreach(println)

//save the data to the grid (routing is flight number, id is flight+date)
data.saveToGrid()

paragraphs.title: Read new data from kafka if started
paragraphs.text:
%spark 
import org.apache.spark.streaming.{Seconds, StreamingContext}
import org.apache.spark.streaming.kafka._
import org.apache.spark.streaming.kafka.KafkaUtils
import common.DelayRec
 
val ssc = new StreamingContext(sc, Seconds(10))

ssc.checkpoint("/tmp")
 
val kafkaParams = Map(
    "metadata.broker.list" -> "localhost:9092",
    "auto.offset.reset" -> "smallest"
)
 
val topics = Set("newFlights")
 
val messagesStream = KafkaUtils.createDirectStream[String, String, StringDecoder, StringDecoder](ssc, kafkaParams, topics)
  
val data = messagesStream.foreachRDD(rdd => rdd..map(line => line.split(",")).filter(rec => rec(4).toString() != "NA").filter(rec => rec(0) !="Year").filter(rec => rec(16).toString() == "ORD").filter(rec => rec(21).toString() != "1").map(rec => new DelayRec( rec(9).toString(),rec(0).toInt,rec(1).toInt,rec(2).toInt,rec(3).toInt,rec(5).toInt,rec(15).toInt,rec(16).toString(),rec(18).toDouble))

data.saveToGrid()

ssc.start

%md
At this stage we will load machine learnning model from the grid
We will also load the new information(in this case the 2008 data) and predict if scheduled flights are going to be delayed, In the grid itselef there is a notify container waiting for those predictions that can trigger logics in case of expected delay.
